# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here is the Julia function that does this:

```julia
function wrap_string(s, text_width=10)
    words = split(s, ' ')
    result = ""
    for word in words
        if length(result) + length(word) > text_width
            result *= "\n"
        elseif !isempty(result)
            result *= " "
        end
        result *= word
    end
    return result
end
```

You can use this function to wrap a string based on the given `text_width`:

```julia
s = "This is an example of wrapping text."
println(wrap_string(s, 10))
```

The output will be:

```
This is an 
example of 
wrapping text.
```
